item.title: Managing Certificates
item.description: Managing Certificates My favorite quick ref: https://www.sslshopper.com/article-most-common-openssl-commands.html Checking certificates on OpenShift You could just as easily modify this for other applications. # cat << 'EOF' >> check-certs.sh #!/bin/bash for filename in `find /etc/origin -name "*.crt*" -o -name "*.pem*" -o -name "*.cer*"` ; do echo $filename; echo " contains" `grep BEGIN $filename | wc -l`; openssl crl2pkcs7 -nocrl -certfile $filename | openssl pkcs7 -print_certs -text -noout | grep -E "
